content.description:
Climb the fun, low angle finger crack; and look for a shallow, left-facing corner higher up for gear before running it out on easy face to the top.

Either build a gear anchor with medium cams or place a directional, and lower off “

Eddyline

” anchors.
content.location: Follow the belay ledge farthest left.

content.description: Follow two bolts up the slab, undercling the large flake leading to the orange headwall. Climb up the steep orange wall utilizing a thin crack on its right side for gear before committing left to good holds.
content.protection: Pro to 1”, 2 bolts, and a 2 bolt anchor.

content.description:
A hard move past the first bolt gets you established in a shallow, right-facing corner (thin gear). Above, you can either finish on “

Crank Yanker

” or stay on the arete, placing a 3” piece on the slab out right before moving back left to the arete, and finishing with the last 10 feet of

CY

. This is how the FA was done.
content.location:
It is left of “

Crank Yanker

.”

content.description: Stem up the right-facing corner using the thin crack on the corner for gear before exiting left at its top where you will encounter a roof. Reach above this, and clip a bolt (crux).
content.protection: Pro to 1”, 1bolt, and a 2 bolt anchor.
content.location:
This ascends the right-facing corner just right of “

Crank Yanker

.”

content.description: Climb steep rock via pinches, and utilize a thin crack for protection. Pull over bulge following moderate crack and face to the top.
content.protection: Pro to 2" and a 2 bolt anchor.
content.location: Begin behind a pine tree on left side of the ledge.

pathTokens: Middle Fork of St. Vrain Canyon
